title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Efficacy and Safety Study of Trontinemab in Participants With Early Symptomatic Alzheimer's Disease (MCI to Mild Dementia Due to AD)
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of trontinemab in participants with early symptomatic Alzheimer's disease (AD) (mild cognitive impairment \[MCI\] to mild dementia due to AD).
drug: Trontinemab (investigational bispecific monoclonal antibody targeting aggregated amyloid‑beta; Brainshuttle TfR1 module for enhanced brain delivery)
explanation_target: Reason: The investigational agent, trontinemab, is a monoclonal antibody engineered to bind aggregated forms of amyloid‑beta and uses Roche's Brainshuttle (TfR1) bispecific design to enhance transport across the blood–brain barrier — i.e., it is a biologic specifically targeting Alzheimer's pathology (amyloid). citeturn0search3turn0search0

Act: The trial description and title state this is a randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled Phase III efficacy and safety study in early symptomatic AD (MCI to mild dementia). Roche/Genentech press releases and news coverage confirm trontinemab is an anti‑amyloid monoclonal antibody and that a Phase III programme in early AD has been initiated/planned. Based on mechanism (anti‑amyloid mAb) and intent (reduce amyloid to slow disease), this matches the 'disease‑targeted biologic' category. citeturn0search3turn0news13

Reflect: Classification check — the drug is a biologic (monoclonal antibody), targets core AD pathology (amyloid‑beta), and the study aims to assess disease‑modifying effects (efficacy/safety in early AD), so it fits 'disease‑targeted biologic' rather than cognitive enhancer or symptom‑management categories. No alternative interpretation fits the description. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Web search results used: Roche/Genentech press releases and coverage describing trontinemab as a Brainshuttle bispecific anti‑amyloid monoclonal antibody and announcing Phase III development. citeturn0search0turn0search3turn0news13
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational agent, trontinemab, is a bispecific monoclonal antibody engineered to bind aggregated forms of amyloid‑beta and uses a Brainshuttle (TfR1) module to enhance transport across the blood–brain barrier — i.e., it directly targets amyloid pathology central to CADRO category A. citeturn0search0turn0search3

Act: The description and company communications state this is a disease‑targeted biologic (anti‑amyloid mAb) being advanced into Phase III for early symptomatic AD (MCI to mild dementia), so the most specific CADRO match is A) Amyloid beta. citeturn0search0turn0news13

Reflect: This intervention targets a single core AD pathology (amyloid‑beta) rather than multiple pathways or a non‑therapeutic purpose, so it should not be classified as Multi‑target (R) or Other (T). Confirmed category: A) Amyloid beta. citeturn0search3
